channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israel and Hamas reach initial ceasefire deal. And, National Guard arrive near Chicago
item.description: Israel and Hamas have agreed to the "first phase" of a ceasefire deal. And, hundreds of National Guard troops were deployed to the greater Chicago are...

item.title: Renewable energy outpaces coal for electricity generation in historic first, report says
item.description: For the first time on record, renewable energy generated more electricity for the planet than coal, a new report says.

item.title: Need a laptop? This retiree refurbishes laptops, gives them away to those in need
item.description: Craig Clark, 79, calls himself the "Tech Fairy." Clark spends his time refurbishing old laptops and giving them away for free to people who need them.

item.title: Pope Leo says faith and love for migrants are connected
item.description: In his first major document as leader of the Catholic Church, Pope Leo urges nations and believers to care for the poorest in society.

item.title: In Utah, a group that helped prompt the redistricting says it's acting on faith
item.description: Mormon Women for Ethical Government was one of the plaintiffs in a lawsuit that could overturn Utah's Republican-leaning map for U.S. House seats. Tha...

item.title: Federal court to weigh Trump’s deployment of National Guard troops in Chicago area
item.description: President Donald Trump’s deployment of National Guard troops to Illinois will face scrutiny at a pivotal court hearing, hours after a small number of ...

item.title: Sneak peek: A Death in the Stairwell
item.description: ALL NEW: After her husband is found dying at the foot of the stairs, a woman accused of murder fights to clear her name. "48 Hours" correspondent Pete...

item.title: Library director fired amid book dispute wins $700,000 settlement
item.description: Terri Lesley was fired amid an uproar over books ​with sexual content and LGBTQ+ themes that some people complained were inappropriate for youngsters.

item.title: In Epstein's cell, a scene of disarray without thorough inspection
item.description: Photos of Jeffrey Epstein's cell show a scene of disarray that never underwent a proper inspection, according to experts.

item.title: Israel and Hamas agree first phase of Gaza peace plan
item.description: The deal raises hopes for a lasting peace after more than two years of conflict.

item.title: Fireworks and a toast to life: Israelis delight at deal to return hostages
item.description: "I can't quite believe this is actually happening, we've been waiting for so long," said Gil Dickman, cousin of hostage Carmel Gat.

item.title: "48 Hours" show schedule
item.description: True crime. Real justice. To miss it would be a crime.

item.title: 9/4: CBS Morning News
item.description: HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to testify before Senate committee today; Refill shops help people reduce their plastic use.

item.title: Lyse Doucet: Gaza deal is a huge moment but this is just the beginning
item.description: The BBC's Lyse Doucet reflects on how long-awaited negotiations to move forward, not further back, appear to be succeeding.

item.title: China restricts export of metals vital for making electronics
item.description: Beijing's monopoly over rare earths is a key bargaining chip in its trade negotiations with the US.

item.title: What to know about the capture of the last of 10 escapees from a New Orleans jail
Madagascar president asks for one year to resolve problems or he will resign
item.description: The movement behind the protests snubbed the meeting where the president made the promise.

item.title: Man charged with sparking the most destructive wildfire in Los Angeles history
